intro: Daucus michelii, commonly known as Micheli's carrot, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features a taproot that is typically white or yellow in color, similar to other members of the carrot family. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it produces small, round fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
